New Records: LeBron James recorded his 41st triple-double as a member of the Lakers.
Key Match Events: LeBron James recorded a triple-double with 21 points, 13 assists, and 12 rebounds.
Anthony Davis scored 31 points, had nine rebounds, and four blocks.
Paul George had an abysmal shooting game with just nine points on 4-of-13 shooting (0-of-8 from three-point range).
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James received praise for helping the Lakers get back on track after losing four of their last five games.
JJ Redick's strategy for the Lakers involves maximizing Davis' offensive ability while allowing James to continue his consistent performance.
The 76ers played without Joel Embiid and Tyrese Maxey, resulting in a lackluster performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LeBron James is the first Laker since Magic Johnson to reach 21 points, 12 rebounds, and 13 assists in a game.
